quotes.quote: Strict parents create sneaky kids.
Fear is a sneaky thief, stealing away precious moments of your life.
A cat, by any other name, is still a sneaky little furball that barfs on the furniture.
Texting is a fundamentally sneaky form of communication, which we should despise, but it is such a boon we don't care. We are all sneaks now.
A sly piece of good luck, which nobody knows of is delightful.
A crafty knave needs no broker.
A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
The crafty person is always in danger; and when they think they walk in the dark, all their pretenses are transparent.
A crafty enemy will set a weak ambush you are meant to break through. Confident because you have dealt with the threat, your guard relaxed, you walk into the second, stronger ambush.
All our parents have levels of deviousness. We're driven to write about this discrepancy between the bright shining selves they invented and the monsters lurking underneath.

What a story is, is devious. It pretends transparency, forthrightness. It engages with ordinary people, ordinary matters, recognizable stuff. But this is all a masquerade. What good stories deal with is the horror and incomprehensibi lity of time, the dark encroachment of old catastrophes.
You can't build the bridge of trust with the scaffolding of lies and underhand deals
Cunning proceeds from lack of capacity.
Cunning and treachery proceed from want of capacity.
Cunning cheats itself wholly, and other people partially.
Cunning pays no regard to virtue, and is but the low mimic of reason.
Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
Cunning is the art of concealing our own defects, and discovering other people's weaknesses.
Never teach your child to be cunning or you may be certain you will be one of the very first victims of his shrewdness.
To be a good diarist, one must have a snouty, sneaky mind.
Humans are pretty crafty but will fold quickly in severe cold.
It would seem that the more irresponsible and crafty one is, the more likely one is to have a talent for storytelling.
That crafty kindness which inveigles me to sacrifice principle is the serpent in the grass - deadly to the incautious wayfarer.
Nothing is more repulsive than a furtively prurient spirituality; it is just as unsavory as gross sensuality.
I think life is so difficult to catch, it's so furtive, that a copy, a film, can in no way catch it and represent it.
In business be as able as you can, but do not be cunning; cunning is the dark sanctuary of incapacity.
Whoever appears to have much cunning has in reality very little; being deficient in the essential article, which is, to hide cunning.
Evil is a far more cunning and persevering propagandist than good, for it has no inward strength, and is driven to seek countenance and sympathy.
